data.reddit:
Age: 31

Sex:M

Height/Weight: 6’1” / around 250

Race:White

No diagnosed conditions and no medications, but he doesn’t see a doctor regularly, former occasional cigarette smoker and current marijuana smoker 

For the past 18 months or so that I’ve been living with my boyfriend, I’ve noticed he needs a LOT more sleep than average. I need less sleep so I think it’s more noticeable to me, but I can’t help but worry about him. He says it’s perfectly normal to sleep as much as he does and that I’m the weird one. I’ve noticed that he’ll sleep 11-12 hours a night if he can, still wakes up tired, and will take 2-3 hour naps after coming home from work because he’s so tired. His job is not excessively physically demanding-he’s usually standing but not doing any heavy lifting or serious moving, and the shifts are between 6 and 8 hours. As someone who struggles with depression myself, I thought it could be a possibility but the only symptom he has consistent with this is exhaustion. He snores as well, but not constantly. Maybe 50% of the time. 

I’ve been trying to convince him to go to a doctor just to confirm that everything’s fine like he says, but he won’t go. Is this something that’s even worth looking into or pushing further?
